cd:Record.cd:Description: Instrument auxiliary file definition (AUX_INS). This file includes information related to the instrument required for processing. It is required for data decompression and ISP decoding.

cd:Float.cd:Description: DeltaT Guard 1 parameter from the instrument radar database [s]. This parameter is used to calculate the internal time delay of the extracted reconstructed replicas.

cd:Record.cd:Description: List of calibration parameter records.

cd:Float.cd:Description: Antenna bore sight off nadir angle at the referenceHeight.
Satellite height at which the instrument elevation angle is aligned with the referenceAntennaAngle.
Sensitivity of the roll steering versus height.

cd:Record.cd:Description: List of calibration parameter records.

Calibration parameter record. There must be one record per swath (16 nominal swaths) per polarisation (4 polarisation combinations for SM, IW or EW, 2 for WV) for a minimum total of 58. There are 128 possible swath number values supported by the downlink, so the maximum number of combinations of swath number and polarisation that can be defined is 512.

cd:Integer.cd:Description: SPPDU [A-12] swath number identifier. The swath number extracted from the downlink is used as an index to select the applicable swathParams record. The IPF uses the swath number and the swath name (below) from this record to perform the mapping between the swathNumber in the downlink and swath name within the AUX_INS, AUX_PP1 and AUX_CAL data.

cd:Text.cd:Description: Canonical name of the swath for this swathNumber.

cd:Record.cd:Description: Radar parameters record.

cd:Float.cd:Description: TOPSAR azimuth steering rate. This field is only relevant for IW and EW swaths and is set to 0.0 for SM and WV swaths.

cd:Record.cd:Description: Pulse parameters. This DSR contains the characteristics for the nominal pulse within this swath.

cd:Array.cd:Description: Pulse amplitude coefficients of nominal chirp replica.
Pulse phase coefficients of nominal chirp replica.

cd:Record.cd:Description: Electronic losses vectors.

Internal calibration instrument parameters. This record contains swath/polarisation channel dependent parameters related to the instrument. There must be one record per swath (16 nominal swaths) per polarisation (4 polarisation combinations for SM, IW or EW, 2 for WV) for a minimum total of 60. There are 128 possible swath number values supported by the downlink, so the maximum number of combinations of swath number and polarisation that can be defined is 512.

Internal calibration instrument parameters. This record contains swath/polarisation channel dependent parameters related to the instrument. There must be one record per swath (16 nominal swaths) per polarisation (4 polarisation combinations for SM, IW or EW, 2 for WV) for a minimum total of 58. There are 128 possible swath number values supported by the downlink, so the maximum number of combinations of swath number and polarisation that can be defined is 512.

cd:Integer.cd:Description: SPPDU [A-12] swath number identifier. The swath number extracted from the downlink is used along with the polarisation to index the applicable internalCalibrationParams record.

cd:Text.cd:Description: Polarisation. Used along with the swathNumber to index the applicable internalCalibrationParams record.

cd:Float.cd:Description: Internal time delay [s] to be applied to the nominal chirp used for range processing. The IPF only uses this parameter when the time delay cannot be derived from the extracted replica due to invalid (poor quality) reconstructed replicas. Nominally, the time delay is estimated from the extracted replicas and it compensates for the dual polarisation mis-registration.

cd:Record.cd:Description: Complex gain to be applied to the range match filter when the nominal chirp is used. It is used to compensate for the amplitude and phase differences between the two channels in dual polarisation data.

Complex gain to be applied to the range match filter when the extracted replica is used. It is used to compensate for the amplitude difference between the two channels in dual polarisation data. Phase difference compensation is not done when the extracted replica is used since the phase difference is already embedded in the extracted replicas.
Modeled PG product. The model is relative to the ascending node of the current orbit.

cd:Float.cd:Description: Interval between adjacent PG Product values in the list.

cd:Array.cd:Description: Array of modeled complex PG model values. The pattern contains attribute "count" complex floating point values separated by spaces. The first value in the array corresponds to the time at the ascending node of the current orbit.

cd:Record.cd:Description: Reference absolute PG value that will be defined by offline analysis of the acquired data. PG values used by the IPF will be normalised by this PG reference value.

cd:Float.cd:Description: Time delay related to the selected decimation filter [s]. This parameter is subtracted from the calculation of the internal time delay of the extracted reconstructed replicas.
Nominal noise value if noise used in processing if no noise value can be calculated from the downlink.

cd:Record.cd:Description: Timeline list. This element contains a list of records that describe the expected packet transmission sequence for each of the Sentinel-1 SAR modes. The SPPDU document allows for 48 entries numbered from 0-47. At minimum, this list must include 9 entries: an entry for each instrument measurement mode.

Each timeline element describes the expected packet transmission sequence for one of the operational modes of the satellite. The SPPDU [A-12] allows for 48 entries numbered from 0-47. At minimum, this list must include 10 entries: an entry for each instrument measurement mode (S1, S2, S3, S4, S5-N, S5-S, S6, IW, EW and WV).

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Event Control Code (ECC) number. This field uniquely identifies the ECC program number for this instrument mode and is used by the IPF for timeline selection.

cd:Text.cd:Description: Instrument mode. This field identifies the instrument mode to which this timeline entry applies.

cd:Record.cd:Description: Sequence list. This element is a list of activity sequences that together form the expected transmission sequence from the SAR instrument for the data take. The number of sequences is arbitrary but there are 5 slots nominally allocated for 1- an initial noise measurement; 2- an initial calibration sequence; 3- image acquisition; 4- final calibration sequence; and, 5- final noise measurement.

Calibration parameter record. There must be one record per swath (16 nominal swaths) per polarisation (4 polarisation combinations for SM, IW or EW, 2 for WV) for a minimum total of 58. There are 128 possible swath number values supported by the downlink, so the maximum number of combinations of swath number and polarisation that can be defined is 512.

cd:Text.cd:Description: The name of the activity within the data acquisition to which this sequence belongs. This field is not used by the IPF for processing. It is for informative purposes only and so the range of the field is unbounded.

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Sequence repeat flag. For the imaging sequence, this field shall be set to “true” to indentify the ispList that represents the imaging operation. This field shall be set to “false” for all other sequences.

cd:Record.cd:Description: ISP list. This element contains contains a list of the expected packets within this sequence in the order they should be received. The number of ISP entries is arbitrary but there are 30 slots defined to capture the worst case EW echo acquisition with PCC2 sequences at the end of each burst.
The ISP element describes one unique, or a series of unique transmission packets. The packets are identified by the packet signal type and contain the number of PRIs expected for this packet type.

cd:Integer.cd:Description: SPPDU [A-12] swath number identifier of the swath used to acquire the packet(s).

cd:Text.cd:Description: Canonical name of the swath to which this packet belongs.

cd:Integer.cd:Description: The number of PRIs that are expected to be suppressed by the instrument immediately before this ISP. Silent PRIs do not show up in the downlinked L0 product but must be known in order to correctly predict the value of the PRI counter for every packet in the reconstructed timeline.
The number of packets of this signal type expected in series.

The number of PRIs that are expected to be suppressed by the instrument immediately following this ISP. Silent PRIs do not show up in the downlinked L0 product but must be known in order to correctly predict the value of the PRI counter for every packet in the reconstructed timeline.

cd:Record.cd:Description: Raw data decoding parameters. This DSR contains the raw data decoding tables and parameters that the IPF requires to perform image processing.
Huffman decoding LUT list. This element contains the Huffman decoding LUTs required to retrieve the HCode value from FDBAQ encoded user data. There is one LUT for each Bit Rate Code for a total of 5.
Huffman decoding LUT. This element contains the Huffman binary tree values for the applicable Bit Rate Code. The MCode is recovered by applying the values in the decoding LUT to the extracted HCode.

cd:Text.cd:Description: Bit Rate Code (as extracted from the BAQ block) to which this LUT applies.

cd:Array.cd:Description: Huffman binary decoding tree values. The tree is implemented using a simple binary coding in which starting at the root, the left side is defined and then the right side is defined. Each node is identified by a 0 followed by a 0 or 1 representing the value of the node. Each leaf is identified by a 1 followed by a 0 or 1 representing the value of the leaf followed by 4 bits representing the MCode value. This encoding scheme is a proposal and will be confirmed prior to CDR.

cd:Record.cd:Description: Normalised Reconstruction Levels LUT list. This element contains the NRL LUTs required to retrieve the normalised reconstructed sample values from the BAQ encoded data. There is one LUT per BAQ mode/FDBAQ Bit Rate Code for a total of 8 LUTs.

Reconstruction Levels LUT. This LUT contains the RL values used to retrieve the reconstructed sample values from the BAQ encoded data. The RL in the table are indexed by: 1. the Bit Rate Code extracted from the BAQ data block for FDBAQ compression; and, 2. the BAQ mode (3-bit, 4-bit or 5-bit) for BAQ compression.

cd:Text.cd:Description: Index code for which the LUT applies. For FDBAQ compression this is the Bit Rate Code extracted from the BAQ block and for BAQ compression this is the BAQ mode.

cd:Array.cd:Description: NRL LUT values. This element contains fifteen double precision floating point values separated by spaces, one entry for each MCode value. Note that some MCodes are not applicable for some FDBAQ and BAQ modes so in this case the entry shall be "NaN" to signify an invalid index.

cd:Record.cd:Description: Simple Reconstruction Parameters LUT list. This element contains the Simple Reconstruction Parameters LUTs required to retrieve the simple reconstructed sample values from the BAQ encoded data. There is one LUT per BAQ mode/FDBAQ Bit Rate Code for a total of 8 LUTs.

Reconstruction Levels LUT. This LUT contains the RL values used to retrieve the reconstructed sample values from the BAQ encoded data. The RL in the table are indexed by: 1. the Bit Rate Code extracted from the BAQ data block for FDBAQ compression; and, 2. the BAQ mode (3-bit, 4-bit or 5-bit) for BAQ compression.

cd:Text.cd:Description: Index code for which the LUT applies. For FDBAQ compression this is the Bit Rate Code extracted from the BAQ block and for BAQ compression this is the BAQ mode.

cd:Array.cd:Description: NRL LUT values. This element contains fifteen double precision floating point values separated by spaces, one entry for each MCode value. Note that some MCodes are not applicable for some FDBAQ and BAQ modes so in this case the entry shall be "NaN" to signify an invalid index.

Sigma Factors LUT. This LUT contains the values used to upscale the normalised reconstructed samples. The sigma factors in the table are indexed by the Threshold Index (THIDX) extracted from the BAQ block. This vector contains 255 single precision floating point numbers separated by spaces.

cd:Record.cd:Description: Values D LUT. This LUT is used to obtain the D value given the Filter Number and the Value C. There is one entry for each Filter Number. Note that for Filter Number 2 the "count" attribute for this element shall be set to 0.

Normalised Reconstruction Levels LUT. This LUT contains the NRL values used to retrieve the normalised reconstructed sample values from the BAQ encoded data. The NRL in the table are indexed by: 1- the Bit Rate Code extracted from the BAQ data block for FDBAQ compression; and, 2- the BAQ mode (3-bit, 4-bit or 5-bit) for BAQ compression.

cd:Integer.cd:Description: The Filter Number extracted from the ISP to which this set of D Values applies.

cd:Array.cd:Description: D Value LUT values. This element contains 26 int values separated by spaces, one entry for each C Value. The "count" attribute indicates the number of D values for this filterNumber.
